headline: CNBC Daily Open: Private credit fears and U.S.-Iran tensions pressure Wall Street
summary: Meanwhile, Blue Owl Capital tightened investor liquidity after selling $1.4 billion in loan assets, raising alarms about stability in the private credit market.

headline: Blue Owl halts fund redemptions, sends private credit stocks lower
summary: Private credit firms are seeing their stocks fall on Thursday after Blue Owl (OWL) permanently halted private credit fund redemptions. Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman discusses this news in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Does Your Retirement Plan Own a Piece of Your Favorite Football Team?
summary: The NFL loosened ownership rules in 2024. Private-equity firms and institutions like pension funds are now trying to get a piece of the action.
